newsData.headline: Explosions ring out at Melitopol plant housing Russian headquarters
newsData.summary:
On the morning of 3 November, explosions rang out at the Refma plant in Melitopol, where the Russian forces have set up their headquarters. 
Source: Ivan Fedorov, Mayor of Melitopol; Volodymyr Rogov, Russian collaborator, on Telegram 
Quote from Fedorov: "Melitopol's occupiers were awakened by explosions instead of alarm clocks.

newsData.headline: Shelling leaves Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant completely without power, back-up generators have fuel to last 15 days
newsData.summary: The Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant (ZNPP) has been left without power after Russian shelling on 2 November damaged the remaining two high-voltage power lines connecting the power plant with Ukraine's energy grid.

newsData.headline: Ukraine�s air defence shoots down 10 Shahed-136 kamikaze drones and Orlan UAVs in 24 hours
newsData.summary:
Over the course of the past 24 hours, Ukraine's air defence forces shot down 10 Russian Shahed-136 attack drones and Orlan UAVs. 
Source: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Facebook, information as of 06:00 on 3 November 
Details: Ukrainian aircraft carried out 21 airstrikes on Russian forces, striking clusters of weapons and equipment and anti-aircraft defence systems.

newsData.headline: Ukrainian Armed Forces repel Russian assaults near 12 cities, towns and villages; Russian forces target critical infrastructure � General Staff report
newsData.summary:
Over the course of the past 24 hours, the Armed Forces of Ukraine have repelled Russian assaults near 12 cities, towns and villages in Luhansk and Donetsk oblasts. 
Source: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Facebook, information as of 06:00 on 3 November 
Details: The Ukrainian Armed Forces have repelled Russian attacks in the vicinity of Makiivka, Nevske and Bilohorivka (Luhansk Oblast) and Verkhnokamianske, Spirne, Bakhmut, Maiorsk, Pervomaiske, Novomykhailivka, Vodiane, Pavlivka and Prechystivka (Donetsk Oblast).

newsData.headline: Ukrainian Armed Forces destroy 4 Russian ammunition dumps and 6 tank wagons in southern Ukraine
newsData.summary: Over the course of the past 24 hours, Ukraine's Rocket Forces and Artillery carried out nearly 150 firing missions and an airstrike on a cluster of Russian military personnel and equipment in southern Ukraine.

newsData.headline: Russian invaders fired on Kharkiv: 3 strikes reported in Kyivskyi district
newsData.summary:
Kharkiv Mayor Ihor Terekhov said Russians attacked the Kyivskyi district in Kharkiv. 
Source: Ihor Terekhov on Telegram 
Quote: "Three strikes in Kyivskyi district. An administrative non-residential building was hit, according to preliminary reports.

newsData.headline: Zelenskyy: We are working with Spain to help create defence shield over Ukraine
newsData.summary: On 2 November, President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a meeting in Kyiv with José Manuel Albares, Spanish Minister of Foreign Affairs, European Union and Cooperation. They spoke, in particular, about the protection of the Ukrainian skies.

newsData.headline: Foreign Minister of Ukraine and Turkish Foreign Minister discuss Black Sea Grain Initiative and Ukrainian prisoners
newsData.summary: Foreign ministers of Ukraine and Turkey Dmytro Kuleba and Mevlut Cavusoglu held a telephone conversation on Wednesday regarding the Black Sea Grain Initiative [an agreement brokered by the UN with Russia and Turkey launched on 22 July to enable ships to transport grain from Ukraine - ed.

newsData.headline: Zelenskyy revealed details of the Staff of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief�s meeting: We are strengthening our positions everywhere
newsData.summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has revealed what was discussed at the meeting of the Staff of the Supreme Commander-in-Chief on 2 November. The main topic was the difficult situation in the Donetsk Oblast.

newsData.headline: Zelenskyy: Russia constantly threatens food exports, but demands "guarantees"
newsData.summary:
President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has stated that Russia's missile strikes constantly threaten the grain corridor routes in the Black Sea, yet Russia demands some security guarantees from Ukraine.  
Source: President Zelenskyy's nightly video address  
Quote: "This morning, a Russian plane launched cruise missiles near  Zmiinyi (Snake) Island, and they actually flew over the grain corridor routes.

newsData.headline: Russia struck the Sumy Oblast with 140 shells and mines in a day
newsData.summary:
On 2 November, Russian troops fired 140 different shells and dropped mines in the Sumy Oblast - several houses, a shop, water supply system, and power lines were damaged. 
Source: Dmytro Zhyvytskyy, the chairman of the Sumy Oblast Military Administration, about the situation at the border area as of 21:30 
Quote from Zhyvytskyy: "Today, the enemy shelled the border area seven times.

newsData.headline: Russians strike Kryvyi Rih with Shahed drone
newsData.summary:
An Iranian-made Shahed-136 kamikaze drone, a munition that Russia is launching en masse at Ukraine, has hit a target in the city of Kryvyi Rih in Dnipropetrovsk Oblast. 
Source: Oleksandr Vilkul, head of Kryvyi Rih Military Administration on Telegram 
 Quote: "Kryvyi Rih.

newsData.headline: Open source intelligence confirms that over 1,400 Russian officers died in Ukraine
newsData.summary:
Losses of high-ranking Russian Army officers in Ukraine stand at 1,402 servicemen as of 1 November 2022.  
Source: StratCom of the Armed Forces of Ukraine citing open source intelligence researchers 
Quote: "1,402 Russian officers have been 'denazified' in Ukraine (this is 5.

newsData.headline: Ukraine's ambassador believes in possibility of changing Israel's position on military assistance
Ukrainian Defence Minister discusses military support with Finnish and Italian counterparts
newsData.summary:
Ukrainian Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov reported on Wednesday that he had telephone conversations with the Defence Ministers of Finland and Italy, Antti Kaikkonen and Guido Crosetto. 
Source: European Pravda 
Ukrainian and Finnish Defence Ministers discussed "additional ways to strengthen Ukraine's defence capabilities.

newsData.headline: Russians struck Zaporizhzhia city suburbs, all Russian Shahed drones are downed
newsData.summary:
In the evening of 2 November, explosions rand out in Zaporizhzhia, and an air-raid siren has been issued in the city. 
Sours: Suspilne, Oleksandr Starukh, the head of Zaporizhzhia Oblast Military Administration, Anatolii Kurtiev, secretary of Zaporizhzhia City Council 
Details: In Zaporizhzhia, the sound of explosions was heard; this is reported by Suspilne's correspondents at 21:11.

newsData.headline: Zelenskyy and Erdoğan discuss grain deal and release of political prisoners
newsData.summary:
President Volodymyr Zelenskyy held a telephone conversation with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Wednesday. 
European Pravda reports that Volodymyr Zelenskyy announced this on Twitter.

newsData.headline: Timothy Snyder becomes UNITED24 ambassador, raising funds for "Shahed Hunter"
newsData.summary:
Timothy Snyder, an American historian, writer and professor at Yale University, has become the latest ambassador for the UNITED24 fundraising platform. 
Source: Office of the President of Ukraine  
Details: Timothy Snyder, professor of history at Yale University, has joined a team of ambassadors of the United24 fundraising platform, initiated by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

newsData.headline: Build-up of Kyiv�s defence lines continues
newsData.summary:
The Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine report further improvements to the system of engineering equipment and the construction of fortifications around Kyiv. 
Source: Ground Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Telegram 
Quote: "The build-up of the defence lines of Kyiv continues! The system of engineering equipment and the construction of fortifications around the capital continue to be improved.

newsData.headline: In Kherson Oblast, Russians evacuate residents of left bank as well
newsData.summary:
The Russian occupiers have started "evacuating" civilians not only from the right but also from the left bank of Kherson Oblast. They are also planning to seize solar energy facilities. 
Source: report of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine as of 18:00, on 2 November 
Quote: "The so-called 'evacuation' of local residents from the temporarily occupied territories of Kherson Oblast is underway.
